titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid to the Administrative Offices records CA.MS.01005
titlestmt.author: Madison White

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-06-06 15:40:57 -0400.

change.item: Finding aid updated as part of the College Archives Survey

did.abstract: Administrative Offices records include pamphlets, office files, exams, reports, meeting minutes.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials in the Smith College Archives are open for use, with the following exceptions: "Office Files," files of records created for the use of the administrative unit that created them, are closed to research for a period of 10 years following their creation. Faculty tenure and promotion files, as well as inactive faculty files are closed permanently. Board of Trustees' records are closed permanently. In all cases, the College Archives will continue to provide public access to materials that were intended to be public at the time of their creation (press releases, publications, etc.)

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Many of the accessions in the collection have container lists that are available upon request by contacting specialcollections@smith.edu

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Administrative Offices records, Smith College Archives, CA-MS-01005, Smith College Special Collections, Northampton, Massachusetts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Administrative Offices records include pamphlets, office files, exams, reports, meeting minutes. The collection is arranged alphabetically by name of office.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Smith College retains copyright of materials created as part of its business operations; however, copyright in other items in this collection may be held by their respective creators. For reproductions of materials that are governed by fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. For instances which may regard materials in the collection not created by Smith College, researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights and obtaining approval from them. Researchers do not need anything further from Smith College Special Collections to move forward with their use.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The term "Administrative Offices" is not a singular entity but rather refers to a group of offices that oversee the daily function of administration within Smith College.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Please note that prior to 2018, folder inventories were not always updated when new material was added to the collection. As a result, folder inventories may not be complete and folder numbers may be incorrect.

dao.title: Link to Smith College Dining Services Strategic Plan website

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The goal of the Smith College Dining Services Strategic Planning initiative was "to analyze the current program with an eye toward understanding current patterns of use, enhancing sustainability performance, emphasizing health and wellness, and improving operational efficiencies." The website documenting this plan was captured in 2018.

did.unittitle: Handbooks for Administrative and Clerical Staff
Institutional Affairs, Institutional Diversity, International Students Office

dao.title: Link to Smith employment opportunities website

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The archived website of the Smith College employment opportunities website (https://smithcollege.hiretouch.com/) was first captured in 2015. Subsequent captures are scheduled periodically. The site is managed by the Office of Human resources and lists current staff and faculty positions available at Smith.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: The searchable database is not available in the archived version of this site, but job listings can be viewed in the "Browse Jobs" view.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The archived website of the Smith College Department of Human Resources is captured as part of the larger Smith College archived website.

did.unittitle: General: Releases, Notes, Clippings, Brochures, Purchasing Department History
Curriculum, Course of Study, Course of Study Changes, Interim, Schedules, Science

dao.title: Link to Smith College course catalog website

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Smith College online course catalog (https://catalog.smith.edu/) was first captured in 2016. Subsequent captures are scheduled annually. Whle the live database is not available in the archived version of this website, there are PDF versions of the catalogs available going back to 2003-04.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Digitized versions of the course catalogs (1872-2011) are also available in the Internet Archive.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials in the Smith College Archives are open for use, with the following exceptions: "Office Files," files of records created for the use of the administrative unit that created them, are closed to research for a period of 10 years following their creation.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Smith College's Community College Connections (CCC) program will gave women from five community colleges across the country the chance to focus exclusively on learning. CCC was designed to provide students at community colleges with the residential college experience, to help them then decide whether they were interested in going on to a four-year college. The program also sought to identify and serve students who are the first in their families to go to college, most of whom had never considered the possibility of attending a four-year college.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Office files, photographs, evaluations, annual reports

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Smith College retains copyright of materials created as part of its business operations; however, copyright in other items in this collection may be held by their respective creators. For reproductions of materials that are governed by fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. For instances which may regard materials in the collection not created by Smith College, researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights and obtaining approval from them. Researchers do not need anything further from Smith College Special Collections to move forward with their use.
